page.title: 12EARLY BALLINDALLOCH HISTORY
page.content: Attached to one wall of the Church is an important group of four carved Pictish Symbol Stones which were found originally under the earlier church or in the churchyard.They may date from the 4th Century and show an eagle, Celtic beast or elephant,mirrors, crescents and V-rod symbols. At Pitchroy two Standing Stones remain from an early Stone Circle. The waters of a well called St. Peter's Well were once thought to possess curative powers, and votive offerings were found in it.To this day,children of Ballindalloch Castle are christened with its water. Ballindalloch Castle has survived some calamitous events in its history. It was,for example, plundered and burned by the Marquis of Montrose in 1645, and flooded by the Great Floods in 1829.
